shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols.1ra-119rb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 1ra-2vb, 67ra-68rb; some fols missing between fols. 1 and 2) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book (fols. 1ra-1vb; incomplete) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 2ra-2vb, 67ra-68rb; incomplete) I-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 47 miracles (fols. 3ra-119rb)

donors.donor: Täklä Haymanot is mentioned in the supplication formulas of fols. 1ra, 2rb, 2va, 4va, 13va, 25ra etc. (sometimes with the name of Wālāttā Mikaʾel - fol. 26va,94rb, 103va, 119rb). Nǝblä Dǝngǝl is mentioned in the supplication formulas of fols. 10vb and 13rb.

dcomments.dcomment: The dating is based on the paleographic data only.

txstates.txstate: The ms. is rebound, the order of the fols. is wrong; some fols. are missing; some fols. are damaged by water or torn; tears are carefully mended on fols. 33, 90

bindings.binding: no boards; a piece of leather, functioning as a cover, is attached to fol. 1a; originally one pair of sewing stations, later additional holes for horizontal stitches were added

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex. Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex. The quires and the leather cover are sewn together by two (some quires with three) horizontal threads passing through two holes on each quire. In the centre fold of most quires a piece of thread lies between the horisontal threads and the parchment. Fols. of quire I is sewn together by crude vertical stitches.

inks.ink: Black; red (vivid vermilion; dark vermilion on fol. 13rb)

txfolios.txfolio: Foliation mistakes: fol. after fol. 13 is not foliated (it has been given the numer 13a). number 51 is given twice (fol. before

squires.squire:
I(2/fols. 1r-2v) - II(7/fols. 3r-9v) - III(8/fols. 10r-16v) - IV(8/s.l.: 6, stub before 3; 3, stub before 6; fols. 17r-24v) - V(6/fols. 25r-30v) - VI(4/s.l.: 1, no stub; 3, stub before 4; fols. 31r-34v) - VII(3/s.l.: 3, no stub; fols. 35r-37v) - VIII(10/fols. 38r-47v) - IX(10/fols. 48r-56v) - X(10/fols. 57r-66v) - XI(9/s.l.: 6, stub before 4; fols. 67r-75v) - XII(9/s.l.: 6, stub before 4; fols. 76r-84v) - XIII(8/fols. 85r-92v) - XIV(4/fols. 93r-96v) - XV(8/fols. 97r-104v) - XVI(7/s.l.: 1, no stub; fols. 105r-111v) - XVII(2/fols. 112r-113v) - XVIII(4/fols. 114r-117v) - XIX(2/fols. 118r-119v) Quires are bound in the wrong order; the correct sequence would be: I - XI - XII - XIII - VI - VII - II - III - IV - X - VIII - IX - XVIII (hand a) V - fol. 113 - XIV - fol. 112 - XV - XVI - XIX (hand b)
Fols. 35, 36 and 37 originally belonged to quire VI; the correct order is 33 - 35 - 36 - 34 - 37; a folio between fols. 33 and 34 is missing. Fols. 112, 113 originally belonged to quire XIV; the correct order is 113 - 93 - 94 - 95 - 96 - 112.
One folio is missing between fols. 1 and 2.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 1-24, 31-92, 114-117 Hand b: fols. 25-30, 93-113, 118-119 Hand a: the shape of letters is broad, the lines are thick; the loops of the fifth order are mostly closed Hand b: the letters are more narrow, the lines are thinner than in the hand a; the loops of the fifth order are mostly closed

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The miracles are numbered; the scribe began the numbering from Story of the family of Adam (Text I-1; since the beginning of this section is missing, the first number is 3) and continued up to the last miracle. The first miracle proper has the number 4.

extras.extra: - Scribbles and doodles: fol. 9v, 11r, 18r, 25r, 37v, 49v, 77r, 117v, 119v - Omitted letters, words written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 2va, 3vb, 5rb, 6ra, 12rb, 14vb, 26rb; in a secondary hand:13a-vb, 32vb, 51ra, 51rb - Words to be omitted encircled with a thin black line: fol. 12rb, 28rb, 51rb; sometimes with a red line, e.g., fol. 96ra) - Words to be omitted marked with thin red and black lines: fol. 118ra - Corrections through erasures: fols. 3rb, 4va, 10rb, 10va, 11vb, 17va, 32va, etc. (sometimes the erased letters are marked with thin lines, e.g., fol. 35ra, 77rb) - Correction through crossing out of a word: fol. 97rb, 99vb, 101va, 104rb - On fol. 38v, the omitted phrase is written in the upper margin, but the tämälläs-sign is missing

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The numeral ፰ in the upper margin of fol. 24v probably indicates the number of the miracle [፳]፰
